solution_line_template: He ate {days_per_week} x {weeks1} x {apples_per_day1} = {apples_first_two_weeks} apples the first two weeks because {days_per_week} x {weeks1} x {apples_per_day1} = {apples_first_two_weeks}
He ate {apples_first_two_weeks} apples in the next three weeks because {apples_first_two_weeks} = <<{apples_first_two_weeks}={apples_next_three_weeks}>>{apples_next_three_weeks}

He ate {days_per_week} x {weeks3} x {apples_per_day3} = <<{days_per_week}*{weeks3}*{apples_per_day3}={apples_final_two_weeks}>>{apples_final_two_weeks} apples in the final two weeks because {days_per_week} x {weeks3} x {apples_per_day3} = <<{days_per_week}*{weeks3}*{apples_per_day3}={apples_final_two_weeks}>>{apples_final_two_weeks}

He averaged {total_apples} / {total_weeks} = <<{total_apples}/{total_weeks}={average_apples_per_week}>>{average_apples_per_week} apples a week because {total_apples} / {total_weeks} = <<{total_apples}/{total_weeks}={average_apples_per_week}>>{average_apples_per_week}
